abstracts.cdata!:
The Ethiopia Third Education Project
            objectives where to (a) improve science teaching and the
            supply of textbooks and other learning aids at various
            educational levels; (b) expand the supply of trained
            agricultural manpower; and (c) improve the rural education
            network of the Ethiopian Orthodox Church (EOC). The project
            was declared effective on August 30, 1974, seven months
            after the original effectiveness date because of a delay in
            reaching agreement with the (EOC) on the operation of the
            training center. The project was completed with a cost
            overrun of less than 1 percent. With regard to the
            project's operating outcome, the USC serves 50 percent
            more than its intended number of students and research and
            community service activities have been improved and
            expanded. This report gives data on the operating outcome of
            the university science center, the science curriculum, the
            agricultural training centers, the community skill training
            center, the technology center, the extension of the animal
            institute, and technical assistance. The report also gives
            some recommendations and lessons learned.
